Commands

Class Sequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • Commands.Sequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class Sequence
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
    A class representing a sequence command, i.e. a list of commands to be executed consecutively.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sequence(java.util.ArrayList<Command> comSeq)
      A new sequence is created, with the given command-sequence.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot, int lastStep)
      Returns whether this sequence contains a basic command the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
      void execute(Robot robot)
      Execute this sequence of commands.
      void executeStep(Robot robot, int nextStep)
      Executes the BasicCommand indicated by the parameter nextStep.
      int getNbBasicCommands()
      Returns the number of basic commands contained in this sequence.
      int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot, int lastStep)
      Returns the step number of the next basic command the robot can execute in this sequence.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(Robot robot)
        Execute this sequence of commands.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that has to execute this sequence.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this sequence.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Command
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of this sequence, namely the word "seq", followed by the respective string representations of the commands in this sequence, and the whole surrounded by brackets.

      • getNbBasicCommands

        public int getNbBasicCommands()
        Returns the number of basic commands contained in this sequence.
        Specified by:
        getNbBasicCommands in interface Command
        Returns:
        The sum of the number of basic commands in each of the commands in this sequence.

      • containsNextStep

        public boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot,
                       int lastStep)
        Returns whether this sequence contains a basic command the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
        Specified by:
        containsNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to check if it can execute a basic command in this sequence.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this sequence.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean true if this sequence contains a next basic command the given robot can execute in view of the last step the robot has executed of this sequence, and of the state of the robot itself. Returns a boolean false if this is not the case.

      • getStepNbOfNextStep

        public int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot,
                      int lastStep)
        Returns the step number of the next basic command the robot can execute in this sequence.
        Specified by:
        getStepNbOfNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to look up the next basic command it can execute in this sequence.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this sequence.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating the stepNb of the next executable basic command in this command for the given robot. This will depend on the last step the robot has executed of this sequence, and on the state of the robot itself.

      • executeStep

        public void executeStep(Robot robot,
               int nextStep)
        Executes the BasicCommand indicated by the parameter nextStep.
        Specified by:
        executeStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that should execute a step of this sequence.
        nextStep - An integer defining unambiguously which basic command the robot has to execute of this sequence.
